thread.title: For UMD's Brees, Versatility is a Virtue
thread.title_full: For UMD's Brees, Versatility is a Virtue

title: For UMD's Brees, Versatility is a Virtue
text:
For UMD's Brees, Versatility is a Virtue 
By Zach Schneider   7:21 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- Andrew Brees kicked a program record 57-yard field goal this past Saturday for the University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) football team, but head coach Curt Wiese says the senior does far more than just kick for the Bulldogs. 
"Andrew's been a tremendous leader of our football team" Wiese said. "What we aim to be is Andrew Brees, and [the record] couldn't have happened to a better guy." 
Brees has also been handling the kickoff and punting duties for UMD in 2015, and last season he spent some time playing wide receiver. 
It's the versatility, he says, that keeps things fun and interesting. 
"What else could you ask for? You come to college football trying to get on the field, and I've been out there in several different ways," he said. "I think my favorite thing to do is run fake field goals or fake punts. I'm just happy to be out there." 
This season, Brees is 7-of-9 on field goals while also averaging 41.1 yards per punt and 60.2 yards per kickoff.
